version_description: Minor bug fixes and performance improvements

- We made erasing and unerasing even more responsive and accurate by using the new low latency touch processing technologies introduced in iOS 9.
- You can now adjust the square crop applied to your image when sending your edited image to Instagram.
- If you would like to find out about new photo editing apps and new features that we at Pocket Pixels are working on you can now sign up for our email newsletter from the in-app help page.

- Fixed a bug that on iOS 8 sometimes made it impossible to paint.

Added in 3.5:
- Support for pressure sensitive drawing on the iPhone 6S
On the latest iPhones you can now temporarily increase the brush size simply by pressing harder on the screen while you are drawing. This is great for quickly coloring in large areas. We also added new settings that allow you to customize the behavior of this new feature.

- Fixed a bug that for some users resulted in blank photo thumbnails showing in the photo library browser.
- Updated Instagram integration.

You can now send your edited image via iMessage from inside the app.
We also fixed a few minor bugs.
Fixed a bug that on some devices caused saved sessions to not load correctly on iOS 10.

• Updated for iOS 11
• Improved handling of wide color gamut images
• Fixed a few minor bugs and made some performance improvements

• Updated the Dropbox integration to work with Dropbox's new API.
• Fixes a few layout problems in the menus on iOS 11.

- Fixed possible delay when opening "All photos" view for the first time
- Added support for iPhone X
- Some iOS 11 layout fixes and performance improvements

- Fixed and improved posting of your edited image to Facebook from inside the app (if you choose to do so).
- Fixed display of tutorial movies on the iPhone 5(S) & SE.

- Added new setting for left handed users, to show the brush monitor on the right instead of the left side
- Added support for iOS 12 and the newest iPhones
- Fixed loading of Nikon RAW images (.NEF files)

- Improved loading of RAW images
- Improved compatibility with future iOS versions
- Fixes crashes on iOS 9.0, 9.1 and 9.2
- Other bug fixes and minor improvements

- Fixed UI issues with a future version of iOS.
- Fixed appearance of the brush size selector.
- Removed Facebook and Instagram integration, because Instagram shut down their API, and Facebook repeatedly caused apps using their SDK to crash on launch.

- Updated to use the new iOS 14 photo picker.
- A few other fixes for improved iOS 14 compatibility.

- Updated for new iPhone screen sizes
- Fixes for a few different minor UI issues
